00308 #ifndef _STRINGUTIL_H_   // avoid clash with similar defs in common/stringutil.h
00309 
00310 inline char *opp_strcpy(char *s1,const char *s2)
00311 {
00312     return strcpy(s1, s2 ? s2 : "");
00313 }
00314 
00315 inline int opp_strlen(const char *s)
00316 {
00317     return s ? strlen(s) : 0;
00318 }
00319 
00320 inline char *opp_strdup(const char *s)
00321 {
00322     if (!s || !s[0]) return NULL;
00323     char *p = new char[strlen(s)+1];
00324     strcpy(p,s);
00325     return p;
00326 }
00327 
00328 inline int opp_strcmp(const char *s1, const char *s2)
00329 {
00330     if (s1)
00331         return s2 ? strcmp(s1,s2) : (*s1 ? 1 : 0);
00332     else
00333         return (s2 && *s2) ? -1 : 0;
00334 }
00335 
00336 #endif //_STRINGUTIL_H_
00337 
00338 // internally used: appends [num] to the given string
00339 inline void opp_appendindex(char *s, unsigned int i)
00340 {
00341    while (*s) s++;
00342    *s++ = '[';
00343    if (i<10)
00344        {*s++ = '0'+i; *s++=']'; *s=0; return;}
00345    if (i<100)
00346        {*s++ = '0'+i/10; *s++='0'+i%10; *s++=']'; *s=0; return;}
00347    sprintf(s,"%d]",i);
00348 }
00349 
00350 inline long double_to_long(double d)
00351 {
00352     // gcc feature: if double d=0xc0000000, (long)d yields 0x80000000 !
00353     // This only happens with long: unsigned long is OK.
00354     // This causes trouble if we in fact want to cast this long to unsigned long, see NED_expr_2.test.
00355     // Workaround follows. Note: even the ul variable is needed: when inlining it, gcc will do the wrong cast!
00356     long l = (long)d;
00357     unsigned long ul = (unsigned long)d;
00358     return d<0 ? l : ul;
00359 }
00360 
00361 // internal
00362 inline std::string double_to_str(double t)
00363 {
00364    char buf[32];
00365    return gcvt(t,16,buf);
00366 }
